posts.post_content: Ridiculous. It's either slightly undercosted or has one (or two) too many abilities. I always thought [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) was balanced, but powerful. [Shepherd of the Lost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shepherd of the Lost) is a balanced angel as well for the same converted mana cost. But this ? It should've had less power and toughness (say, 3 each), be legendary or cost more, in my opinion. Rarity should have nothing to do with a card's actual power, but instead provide possibilities not present on the more common cards.
posts.html:
Ridiculous. It's either slightly undercosted or has one (or two) too many abilities. I always thought Serra Angel was balanced, but powerful. Shepherd of the Lost is a balanced angel as well for the same converted mana cost. But this ? It should've had less power and toughness (say, 3 each), be legendary or cost more, in my opinion. Rarity should have nothing to do with a card's actual power, but instead provide possibilities not present on the more common cards.

posts.post_content:
Just a *little bit* of power-creep over [serra angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=serra angel). The only thing balancing this is that it is a "mythic rare." So it's balanced because only people willing to invest $160 into their deck can use a playset. Everyone else has to settle for less. Just make sure you play magic with people of the same socio-economic standing as you, or lower, and you'll be fine.   
  
Then again, how much does [terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=terminate) cost? heh heh heh. Die, Angel!

Posted By: Champion_Kitsune (10/25/2009 5:55:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is clearly a 5/5 star card in a vacuum, but the fact that it truly seems to throw any semblance of balance out the window is very frustrating. At the very least, it should have been legendary-- even then, it's undercosted. Hell, [Xanthrid Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xanthrid Demon) costs more than this, and you have to feed it a creature every turn! Oh, and Xanthrid is the **only** flyer in the set naturally bigger than this guy, but even he can't kill her because of protection! Absurdo card.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Completely broken, absurd card. Anything SPLASHING white will run 3 or even a playset. It's the default five drop. It adds NOTHING to the game, it doesnt have interaction, drawbacks, it's not a situational card or anything, well done Hasbro, keep ruining Magic. This is why i dont play it anymore outside of MWS, standard decks run 4x of this 40$ crap and extended decks with creatures MUST run a playset of expensivegoyfs if they dont want to lose. If tarmogoyf is what we see on 'Futuresight' as rare, hell, i can't even imagine what kind of unbalanced crap will wizards come up with for the 'mythic rare' slot in few years.

posts.post_content:
baneslayer's lifelink, first strike and +1/+1 (not to mention pro demons/dragons) > serra's vigilance.  
   
both die to removal. (removal excuse is invalid)  
  
what is serra's advantage giving that it has the same cost as baneslayer?  
  
it has none.  
  
realistically serra = virtually useless.  
  
baneslayer will replace it nine times out of ten.  
  
aka power creep.

Posted By: NecroArTeest (12/4/2009 7:23:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's a powerful creature card with an efficient casting cost and that drives the prices up. Even though there are plenty of low-cost creature removal cards in all formats, Baneslayer Angel demands attention when it enters the battlefield. It is a threat that cannot be ignored. That also increases the retail price of the card.  
  
[Juzám Djinn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juzám Djinn) is also a creature card that has a high retail price, because it is powerful and efficient for its casting cost. Thus, even after Baneslayer Angel rotates out of Standard, I expect its retail price to remain relatively high.
posts.html:
It's a powerful creature card with an efficient casting cost and that drives the prices up. Even though there are plenty of low-cost creature removal cards in all formats, Baneslayer Angel demands attention when it enters the battlefield. It is a threat that cannot be ignored. That also increases the retail price of the card.

Juzám Djinn is also a creature card that has a high retail price, because it is powerful and efficient for its casting cost. Thus, even after Baneslayer Angel rotates out of Standard, I expect its retail price to remain relatively high.
